projects.title: Shelf Life
projects.description: Shelf Life is a project I worked on with a team of coders for our final project at the University of Minnesota Full Stack Coding Boot Camp. It included a login, a function to look up and add books to your reading diary, and an interface where the user can arrange the books on a digital bookshelf any way they see fit. It's meant not only as a reading log but as a creative outlet. Since the end of the boot camp, I have added features to the software on the creative side: a book studio to give more control over how books look on the shelf, a flag for audiobooks, and some presentation niceties.

projects.title: Be For Reel
projects.description: Be For Reel was a project I worked on as the leader of a five-person team in the University of Minnesota Full Stack Coding Boot Camp. It originally utilized Handlebars templating and a MySQL database. Following the boot camp, I rebuilt Be for Reel from the ground up, using a full MERN stack and a GraphQL database interface. It includes a username/password login with email confirmation, poll creation tools tied into IMDb's public API and ChatGPT, polls enriched with IMDb data, a list of most-voted-on films, and a search tool to find polls, users, and movies. Users can submit a comment with their vote. The front page displays six randomly-chosen polls, with the movie poster of one of its randomly-chosen options. Users have a profile page, which shows all their created quizzes and all their submitted comments.
projects.shortDescription: A movie poll site powered by IMDb

projects.title: Dragging Exercise
projects.description: I was planning a web-based interface for a product, and I created this snippet of code in vanilla Javascript as a proof of concept. No libraries or frameworks. Drag the ten-second strip to navigate or click on the full disclosure below it. Control-click to create a report strip, or option-click-drag to create movable calipers to measure heart rate. This project was never begun beyond this.
